glsa.title: X.org, XFree86: Integer and stack overflows in libXpm
glsa.synopsis: libXpm, the X Pixmap library that is a part of the X Window System, contains multiple stack and integer overflows that may allow a carefully-crafted XPM file to crash applications linked against libXpm, potentially allowing the execution of arbitrary code.

package.name: x11-base/xfree
package.arch: amd64 hppa ia64 mips ppc sparc

background.p: XFree86 and X.org are both implementations of the X Window System.

description.p: Chris Evans has discovered multiple integer and stack overflow vulnerabilities in the X Pixmap library, libXpm, which is a part of the X Window System. These overflows can be exploited by the execution of a malicious XPM file, which can crash applications that are dependent on libXpm.

impact.p: A carefully-crafted XPM file could crash applications that are linked against libXpm, potentially allowing the execution of arbitrary code with the privileges of the user running the application.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All X.org users should upgrade to the latest version:

Note: Usage of XFree86 is deprecated on the AMD64, HPPA, IA64, MIPS, PPC and SPARC architectures: XFree86 users on those architectures should switch to X.org rather than upgrading XFree86.
